name: Dutch national shellfish monitoring in the coastal zone
description: Every year, Wageningen Marine Research carries outshellfish surveys in the Dutchcoastal waters (Wadden Sea, Oosterschelde, Westerschelde and Coastal Zone), investigating the distribution and size of the most important commercial shellfish species. These aremainly mussels, cockles, knife hives and Japanese oysters, but also otherspecies with a certain importance for ecology or fishingareincluded. In addition, catchdata from professional fishing are also collected. The data is used by thegovernment when deciding whether or not to permit fishing.
